page.title: 09Our Visit To A Pheasantry
page.content: When we were in the park we were met by the children of the gamekeeper who are two pupils at our school. When we got to the bank above the pheasantry we could see lots of wire fencing everywhere. There are about 1-2 acres of pens. Around the wire is an electric fence to keep the foxes out. First we went to look for the hidden eggs.I found an egg which had been pecked by a jackdaw or magpie. Next we saw two of the chickens which we had reared in school in March which are now three months old. After collecting the eggs they are washed and this is a complicated procedure. The eggs are put in a basket then into a bucket of hot water with detergent in it. A machine shakes the bucket and the eggs come out shining. After three weeks in an incubator the eggs hatch and the day old chicks are sent away.
